data.question: What is the empirical formula of Cu-S-M9?
At what pressure does Cu-S-M9 start to show irreversible structural change according to in situ XRD?
Is the average size of the Cu nanoclusters determined by the size of the starting crystal?
What is the role of sulfur in the pressure-driven mechanochemical reaction of Cu-S-M9?
data.answer: Sulfur serves as the reducing agent, forming an oxidized species.

data.question: Does heating Cu-S-M9 to 400 °C under vacuum yield elemental copper?
What happens to the Cu(i) in Cu-S-M9 under hydrostatic pressure?
What is the lattice spacing consistent with the [111] spacing of face-centred cubic copper observed in TEM images after compression?
Is the reactivity of the Cu-S-M9 system temperature-dependent?
What indicates the formation of elemental copper in the Cu-S-M9 system under pressure?
data.answer: Transmission electron microscopy images showing crystalline nanoclusters with lattice spacing of 2.08 Å.

data.question: Does the compression of Cu-S-Ada to 20 GPa result in the formation of elemental copper clusters?
What is the role of adamantyl groups in the Cu-S-Ada system under hydrostatic pressure?
data.answer: The adamantyl groups impede relative movement and deformation of the Cu–S mechanophore.

data.question: What is the configuration of the diamondoid sidegroups in Ag-S-mDia?
Does the trans configuration in Ag-S-Ada facilitate the relative sliding of the two Ag–S chains?
What is the predicted outcome of the mechano-reactivity in Ag-S-Ada under hydrostatic pressure?
data.answer: The reduction of Cu(i) by sulfur observed in Cu-S-M9 would be hindered in Cu-S-Ada.

data.question: What does the presence of both silver and sulfur in EDS of a sample compressed to 20 GPa indicate?
data.answer: It indicates the composition of the pristine Cu-S-Ada is preserved.

data.question: Is the deformation observed in Cu-S-Ada after compression to 20 GPa reversible?
What does the formation of elemental silver by hydrostatic compression in Ag-S-mDia demonstrate?
data.answer: It demonstrates that steric effects control the deformation and associated reactivity in one-dimensional MOCs.

data.question: Are the molecular anvils more atomic-efficient compared to polymeric mechanochemical systems?
What does the decrease in the Cu(i) peak intensity at 8–13 GPa indicate?
data.answer: It indicates the reduction of Cu(i) to form metallic Cu(0).

data.question: What is the significance of the absence of satellite peaks in the Cu 2p X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy of compressed Cu-S-M9?
data.answer: It excludes the formation of Cu(ii) species.
